explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques for predicting customer churn in the telecom industry.
explanations.classification: The study involves predicting customer churn, which is a classification problem where customers are classified as churn or non-churn.
explanations.feature learning: The paper mentions the use of convolutional neural networks (CNN) for automatic feature selection and representation.
explanations.feature representation: The study integrates all string attributes in the dataset (ISAD) to enhance feature representation for better model performance.
explanations.neural network: The paper employs convolutional neural networks (CNN) as part of the proposed model.
explanations.deep learning: The study utilizes deep learning techniques, specifically CNN with variational autoencoder, for churn prediction.
explanations.representation learning: The paper discusses how CNN and variational autoencoder help in learning better representations of the input data.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The study uses CNN for its ability in feature selection and representation.
explanations.CNN: The paper explicitly mentions the use of convolutional neural networks (CNN) in the proposed model.
explanations.autoencoder: The study incorporates a variational autoencoder as part of the model to enhance churn prediction accuracy.
